intro: Hieracium burserianum, commonly known as the Burserianum hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces yellow to orange flower heads composed of numerous small florets, and its leaves are usually hairy and serrated. Hieracium burserianum is often found in disturbed areas and can spread through both seeds and vegetative reproduction.
